Class CountryCatalogue

  • java.lang.Object
    • CountryCatalogue

  • public class CountryCatalogue
extends java.lang.Object
    The CountryCatalogue implements an application that reads information from a textfile, organises it in a catalogue, and provides functionalities to manipulate the data
    Since:
    2017-01-31
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Olivier Perrault (250890527)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CountryCatalogue()
      First overload of CountryCatalogue's constructor
      CountryCatalogue(java.lang.String file_country, java.lang.String file_continent)
      Second overload of CountryCatalogue's constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCountry(Country c)
      adds the provided country to the catalogue array.
      void filterCountriesByContinent(java.lang.String continent)
      print out all the countries from a specified continent.
      int findCountryWithLargestPop()
      Returns the index location of the country with the largest population currently in the catalogue.
      int findCountryWithSmallestArea()
      Return the index location of the country with the smallest area currently in the catalogue.
      void findMostPopulousContinent()
      Prints out the continent, and the total population of the continent with the largest population (based only on the countries in the catalogue)
      Country getCountry(int index)
      takes an index as a parameter and returns a Country object from the indexed location in the catalogue
      int getNumCountries()
      Accessor method for numCountries (number of countries in the catalogue)
      void printCountriesFilterDensity(int l_b, int u_b)
      Prints out details of all the countries whose population densities lie within a specified population density range.
      void printCountryCatalogue()
      which simply calls the toString() method for each Country currently in the catalogue instance variable and prints these strings.
      void removeCountry(java.lang.String countryName)
      which receives as parameter the name of a country and removes it from the catalogue.
      void saveCountryCatalogue(java.lang.String filename)
      Which will write the catalogue’s content to a file.
      int searchCatalogue(java.lang.String countryName)
      receives as parameter the name of a country and returns an int representing the index of the country in catalogue.
      void setPopulationOfACountry(java.lang.String countryName, int pop)
      which receives as parameter the name of a country and an integer value and changes the population of that country to the specified value.

        public Country getCountry(int index)
        takes an index as a parameter and returns a Country object from the indexed location in the catalogue
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Country c

      • printCountryCatalogue

        public void printCountryCatalogue()
        which simply calls the toString() method for each Country currently in the catalogue instance variable and prints these strings.

      • filterCountriesByContinent

        public void filterCountriesByContinent(java.lang.String continent)
        print out all the countries from a specified continent.
        Parameters:
        String - name

      • searchCatalogue

        public int searchCatalogue(java.lang.String countryName)
        receives as parameter the name of a country and returns an int representing the index of the country in catalogue. Notifies user if not found
        Parameters:
        String - name
        Returns:
        Country c

      • removeCountry

        public void removeCountry(java.lang.String countryName)
        which receives as parameter the name of a country and removes it from the catalogue. Notifies user if not found This method can use searchCatalogue.
        Parameters:
        String - CountryName

      • setPopulationOfACountry

        public void setPopulationOfACountry(java.lang.String countryName,
                                    int pop)
        which receives as parameter the name of a country and an integer value and changes the population of that country to the specified value. This method can call searchCatalogue. Notify user if item was successfully altered.
        Parameters:
        String - name
        int - value

      • saveCountryCatalogue

        public void saveCountryCatalogue(java.lang.String filename)
        Which will write the catalogue’s content to a file. This method calls the Country’s writeToFile() method for each country in the catalogue. Carefully closes the file.
        Parameters:
        String - file (name of the file)

      • findCountryWithLargestPop

        public int findCountryWithLargestPop()
        Returns the index location of the country with the largest population currently in the catalogue.
        Returns:
        int index

      • findCountryWithSmallestArea

        public int findCountryWithSmallestArea()
        Return the index location of the country with the smallest area currently in the catalogue.
        Returns:
        int index

      • printCountriesFilterDensity

        public void printCountriesFilterDensity(int l_b,
                                        int u_b)
        Prints out details of all the countries whose population densities lie within a specified population density range. This method takes two integers specifying the population density range inclusively (low and high).
        Parameters:
        int - l_b (lower bound)
        int - u_b (upper bound)

      • findMostPopulousContinent

        public void findMostPopulousContinent()
        Prints out the continent, and the total population of the continent with the largest population (based only on the countries in the catalogue)
